articles.headline: Attention Shoppers: Carbon Offsets in Aisle 6
articles.snippet: Companies that have been touting their own environmental responsibility are now letting to their customers make donations to offset their energy usage.
articles.abstract: Companies that have been touting their own environmental responsibility are now letting to their customers make donations to offset their energy usage.
articles.lead_paragraph: ARE you willing to spend more so that electricity will be generated from animal manure instead of coal? If you live in Vermont, the public utility there will use your money to buy “cow power” made on local farms.

articles.headline: F.C.C. Chief Questioning Radio Deal
articles.snippet: The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission has questioned Congressional testimony by the architect of a proposed satellite radio merger.
articles.abstract: The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission has questioned Congressional testimony by the architect of a proposed satellite radio merger.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 6 — Kevin J. Martin, the chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, has privately questioned recent Congressional testimony by the architect of a proposed merger of the nation’s two satellite radio companies that subscribers would both pay the same monthly rate and receive significantly more programming.

articles.headline: What’s So Bad About Big?
articles.snippet: Renewable-energy technology isn’t just for the roof anymore.
articles.abstract: Renewable-energy technology isn’t just for the roof anymore.
articles.lead_paragraph: “SMALL is beautiful,” wrote the economist E. F. Schumacher almost 35 years ago. In most areas of the economy, he reasoned, production had become too big and too centralized.

articles.headline: Venezuela Disavows 1980s-Era Bonds
articles.snippet: An international financial dispute between a group of Ohio investors and Venezuela’s solicitor general is playing out in federal court.
articles.abstract: An international financial dispute between a group of Ohio investors and Venezuela’s solicitor general is playing out in federal court.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, March 6 — The plot would seem to come right out of a novel in which the reader does not know whom to believe.

articles.headline: The Data Tell a Different Story on Heart Patients
articles.snippet: Gaps in insurance aren’t the only problem with the medical system. Hospitals should be required to report more information.
articles.abstract: Gaps in insurance aren’t the only problem with the medical system. Hospitals should be required to report more information.

articles.headline: Makers of Sodas Try a New Pitch: They’re Healthy
articles.snippet: In coming months, Coca-Cola and PepsiCo will introduce carbonated drinks fortified with vitamins and minerals.
articles.abstract: In coming months, Coca-Cola and PepsiCo will introduce carbonated drinks fortified with vitamins and minerals.

articles.headline: In ’05 Investing, Obama Took Same Path as Donors
articles.snippet: Barack Obama bought more than $50,000 worth of stock in two speculative companies whose major investors included some of his biggest political donors.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama bought more than $50,000 worth of stock in two speculative companies whose major investors included some of his biggest political donors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Less than two months after ascending to the United States Senate, Barack Obama bought more than $50,000 worth of stock in two speculative companies whose major investors included some of his biggest political donors.
articles.byline: By Mike McIntire and Christopher Drew

articles.headline: Buyout Bid Becomes Proxy Fight
articles.snippet: The buyout of Clear Channel has become a test of wills between some of the nation’s largest investors.
articles.abstract: The buyout of Clear Channel has become a test of wills between some of the nation’s largest investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: “What’s the phrase that pays?” Elvis Duran, a disc jockey on Z100, has been asking listeners for years on his radio show in New York before offering them $10,000 for the right answer.

articles.headline: Venture Capitalists Want to Put Some Algae in Your Tank
articles.snippet: Investors are now searching for a holy grail that symbolizes wealth in both profits and what’s good for the environment.
articles.abstract: Investors are now searching for a holy grail that symbolizes wealth in both profits and what’s good for the environment.
articles.lead_paragraph: NILAND, Calif. — The idea of replacing crude oil with algae may seem like a harebrained way to clean up the planet and bolster national security.
